intro: Sphedamnocarpus decaryi, commonly known as the Decary's spherocarpus, is a rare and little-known plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spherical fruits that contain a single seed. The plant is adapted to the humid, tropical conditions of its native habitat, with leaves that are typically elliptical and arranged alternately along the stems. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
